Package rmi

Class ServerInvoker

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
rmi.ServerInvoker
All Implemented Interfaces:
InvokerInterface, Serializable, Remote
public class ServerInvoker extends UnicastRemoteObject implements InvokerInterface
The ServerInvoker class represents a remote server that hosts an Invoker, which is responsible for executing functions and managing available resources.

This class extends the UnicastRemoteObject and implements the InvokerInterface for RMI communication.

See Also:

    • invoke

      public <T, R> R invoke(Invokable<T,R> invokable, T args, String id) throws Exception
      Executes a synchronous function passed by reference, applying observers and decorators.
      Specified by:
      invoke in interface InvokerInterface
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the Invokable.
      R - The type of the result returned by the Invokable.
      Parameters:
      invokable - The function to be executed and the RAM it consumes.
      args - The arguments needed by the function, of type T.
      id - The identifier of the function, needed by observers and decorators to store data correctly.
      Returns:
      The result of the function invoked, of type R.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the invocation process.

    • invokeAsync

      public <T, R> Future<R> invokeAsync(Invokable<T,R> invokable, T args, String id) throws Exception
      Executes an asynchronous function passed by reference. If there is no space in the pool of threads, it waits and then gets invoked.
      Specified by:
      invokeAsync in interface InvokerInterface
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input parameter for the Invokable.
      R - The type of the result returned by the Invokable.
      Parameters:
      invokable - The function to be executed asynchronously and the RAM it consumes.
      args - The arguments needed by the function, of type T.
      id - The identifier of the function, needed by observers and decorators to store data correctly.
      Returns:
      A Future representing the asynchronous result of invoking the function.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the asynchronous invocation process.

    • selectInvoker

      public InvokerInterface selectInvoker(long ram) throws NoPolicyManagerRegistered, NoInvokerAvailable, RemoteException
      Selects an Invoker that has enough RAM to execute an Invokable consuming the specified RAM.
      Specified by:
      selectInvoker in interface InvokerInterface
      Parameters:
      ram - The amount of RAM in MegaBytes that the Invokable will consume.
      Returns:
      The Invoker that will execute the function.
      Throws:
      NoPolicyManagerRegistered - If there is no PolicyManager registered with the Invoker.
      NoInvokerAvailable - If there is no Invoker with enough max RAM or a remote communication-related exception occurs.
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.

    • setDistributionPolicyManager

      public void setDistributionPolicyManager(int size, long ram) throws NoInvokerAvailable, RemoteException
      If needed prepares the PolicyManager for a group invocation.
      Specified by:
      setDistributionPolicyManager in interface InvokerInterface
      Parameters:
      size - The size parameter for the Distribution PolicyManager.
      ram - The RAM parameter for the Distribution PolicyManager.
      Throws:
      NoInvokerAvailable - If there is no Invoker available based on the Distribution PolicyManager's strategy.
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.
